results.abstract: Astronaut John B Herrington takes space walk outside shuttle Endeavour and removes obstacle blocking railcar on tracks of International Space Station (S)

headline.main: Snag Hinders a Shuttle Mission Spacewalk

results.snippet: An astronaut turned into a spacewalking detective today, finding and removing an obstacle blocking a railcar on the tracks of the International Space Station.    Cmdr. John B. Herrington of the space shuttle Endeavour found the problem -- a stowed...
results.lead_paragraph: An astronaut turned into a spacewalking detective today, finding and removing an obstacle blocking a railcar on the tracks of the International Space Station. Cmdr. John B. Herrington of the space shuttle Endeavour found the problem -- a stowed antenna -- then struggled for several minutes to release it.

results.abstract: Profile of Katherine Oliver, who has been named commissioner of New York City's Office of Film, Theater and Broadcasting and faces challenge of stemming flow of film work north to Canada; photo (M)

headline.main: Selling the Celluloid City, With Style

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: FILM, THEATER AND BROADCASTING, OFFICE OF

results.snippet: WHEN the out-of-the-blue phone call came to Katherine Oliver in London last March, she was supervising 600 people in 25 cities with a budget in the hundreds of millions. Her title? Managing director of global broadcasting operations for Bloomberg...
results.lead_paragraph: WHEN the out-of-the-blue phone call came to Katherine Oliver in London last March, she was supervising 600 people in 25 cities with a budget in the hundreds of millions. Her title? Managing director of global broadcasting operations for Bloomberg L.P. Daniel L. Doctoroff, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's deputy for economic development, was on the line. He made her an offer she could easily have refused: become commissioner of the Mayor's Office of Film, Theater and Broadcasting, with its quaint $1 million budget, a staff of 17, and a salary line -- $140,000 -- that was a paltry fraction of her London take-home.

results.abstract: Fay Gillis Welles, pioneer aviator and journalist, dies at age 94; photo (M)

headline.main: Fay Gillis Wells, 94, Aviator and Journalist

results.snippet: Fay Gillis Wells, a pioneer aviator, a White House correspondent and a writer who covered Hollywood accompanied by her pet leopard, Snooks, died on Dec. 2 in Fairfax, Va. She was 94.    She had last lived in Alexandria, Va., her son, Linton Wells II,...
results.lead_paragraph: Fay Gillis Wells, a pioneer aviator, a White House correspondent and a writer who covered Hollywood accompanied by her pet leopard, Snooks, died on Dec. 2 in Fairfax, Va. She was 94. She had last lived in Alexandria, Va., her son, Linton Wells II, said, but her life had many takeoffs and landings -- and a famous bailout.

results.abstract: Barbara Morgan, elementary school teacher who became astronaut, will be in crew going to International Space Station next year; Morgan, 51, was backup for Christa McAuliffe, who was to have been first teacher in space when she died in explosion of space shuttle Challenger in 1986 (S)

headline.main: Teacher Chosen for Space Station Mission

results.snippet: After more than 15 years of dreaming, Barbara Morgan finally got her long-awaited assignment today. An elementary school-teacher-turned-astronaut, Mrs. Morgan will be in a crew going to the International Space Station next year.    Mrs. Morgan, 51,...
results.lead_paragraph: After more than 15 years of dreaming, Barbara Morgan finally got her long-awaited assignment today. An elementary school-teacher-turned-astronaut, Mrs. Morgan will be in a crew going to the International Space Station next year. Mrs. Morgan, 51, was the backup for Christa McAuliffe, who was to have been the first teacher in space when she died in the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger in January 1986. Mrs. Morgan, a former teacher at McCall-Donnelly Elementary School in McCall, Idaho, lobbied for years to reinstate the Teacher in Space program.
